title: Jacob Blake Shooting: What We Know About the Shooting in Kenosha
sub_head: Justice Department won’t bring federal civil-rights charges against officer who shot Jacob Blake seven times in 2020
body:
The Justice Department won’t bring federal civil-rights charges against the police officer whose shooting of Jacob Blake in Kenosha, Wis. in August 2020 sparked weeks of violent unrest in the small city south of Milwaukee.
Officials said Friday that federal prosecutors had found insufficient evidence to prove that the officer, Rusten Sheskey, who is white, willfully used excessive force when he shot Mr. Blake, who is Black, seven times, leaving him paralyzed from the waist down.
